text: So, I was born in Moscow during the Cold War
My dad is American
My mother's Russian.
Basically, my parents couldn't be together,
so my mother was in Russia, pregnant with me
My dad is in Sweden, campaigning to get us out
We ended up getting on a nuclear disarmament agreement
between Gorbachev and Reagan, and we were one of the first
families to be reunited during the Cold War.
So, like, from the beginning my life is very political and
Having a purpose behind everything is kind of what drives me
Dance has always been one of those things where you feel the most alive,
and really who I am and free
But I always separated my identities, like
I thought to make a change in the world
I would have to do something like this in UN or an NGO
or become president

and started working for the UN but still like

and then I was also like going to the U.N. during the day. I had this like really
Polarized life, and I think the biggest "Yes"
And one of the most transformational points of my life
was moving to Kenya.
